Posts.Title: Energy Level Dropping to O- 3 wks after surgery Dejaboo Dejaboo

Posts.Content: leener wrote: Has anyone ever had to have this done because of excess fluid production? I had my pedicule TRAM on 2/19. I had my drains in for 4 1/2 weeks. Had to be pulled because of risk of infection. Then I had to be drained weekly with a needle until 4/29 when another drain was inserted. It stayed in for another 4 1/2 weeks and then was pulled about 1 1/2 weeks ago. More fluid is now collecting again, and he wants to put in some sort of a vacuum with sponges that will need to be changed, so I'll be open. Has anyone had this done? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: inserting a "vacuum" with sponges leener cindiedee

Posts.Content: May 13, 2008 06:04PM leener wrote: I had a pediculed TRAM on 2/19. I have had significant problems with fluid output. PS put a drain in again 2 weeks ago(after they stayed in for 4 weeks) so he could stop draining me manualy (3 weeks of this) each Wednesday. I am stilll putting out about 50 cc daily. He has me scheduled for the nipple reconstruction on 5/30. He'll be using some of the excess skin on the sideds of my pedicule tummy scar. Not sure if this fluid issue will hod me up or not. RE the hot flashes. I live in FL and these have been a huge issue for me. I take 1 1/2 tabs of clonodine 2x daily for this. VItamin E and Neuronton were also recommended for me. Do you suffer tremors from the Tamoxifen?
Posts.Title: Nipple - Areolar Reconstruction ferrajina candy2007

Posts.Content: leener wrote: I had a unilateral pediculed TRAM on 2/19. Drains removed 3/19, despite 1 producing more than 100cc's output daily. They were pulled as they had been in 4 weeks. Had to go in today to have more than 300cc's removed with a catheter needle and 5 syringes. Anyone else have this? Is thete anything else I can do re activity/food & drink, to help this along? I am 5 weeks out today, but can't go back to work or even my daily activities. Any info would be helpful. Eileen Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 02:35PM leener wrote: I am scheduled for what I pray willl be my final on 6/17. This will make 9 surgeries in less that 2 years. I am still having trouble with drainage, so my PS will address that and do the nipple as well as get rid of the "dog ears" from the pediculed TRAM done on 2/19.
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: leener wrote: I recently heard from a dear friend, Cindy (like a sister to me).  who has been there through all my major and minor battles.  Cindy is very dear to me and has now reached out for help with a friend of hers from high school that has recently found out after her mother's diagnosis of breast cancer, that she "has the gene" and is at 85% risk for BC and also at risk for ovarian cancer.  She is the mother of 2 children.  She is scheduled for a "pre-emptive" double mastectomy, with reconstruction using the TRAM that I had.  Additionally....eventually, she'll have a hysterectomy because of the ovarian issues.   Shy of my own experience with the mastectomy, and TRAM reconstruction issues (as well as having young children during the experience), I am not sure how to advise her.  Clearly we have lots in common, but the ovarian and hysterectomy issue with hormanal side effects related to that, are outside my realm.  I will obviously refer her to this site which was extremely helpful to ME during my challenges and questions, but am I on the right track?  I remember how desperate I felt when first diagnosed-I think we all do.  At that point I was looking for someone or something that could help me in my journey---and this site was awesome and hugely comforting.    Since she is "High Risk"  I want to be sure that I point her in the right direction.  Is this the forum for her?  Any other ideas? I am open to suggestions, especially since I do not know her personally.  Thanks for any feedback-  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: friend of a friend in trouble leener mawhinney
